item.title: Temp Mute - Please look
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:2, topic:509708”][code=java]
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“tempmute”) && c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3) {

try {   
    String[] args = playerCommand.split("-");
                            if(args.length < 1) {
                                c.sendMessage("Currect usage: ::tempmute-playername");
                                return;
                            }
                            String playerToMute = args[1];
                           muteTimer = 48*3600000;

    for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
        if(Server.playerHandler.players != null) {
            if(Server.playerHandler.players.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMute)) {
                Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players;
                c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName+" for "+muteTimer/3600000+" Hours");
                                                    c2.muteEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ muteTimer;
                break;
            } 
        }
    }
                             
                                                                                 
} catch(Exception e) {
    c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
}

}[/code]

I’m assuming it works as is.[/quote]
Any where put this
int muteTimer = 483600000;
and in the command use like
muteTimer = 483600000; instead of int muteTimer = 48*3600000;

Read full topic

@runescape_sucks wrote:

[code=java]int muteTimer = 48*3600000;
if (playerCommand.startsWith(“tempmute”) && c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3) {

try {   
    String[] args = playerCommand.split("-");
                            if(args.length < 1) {
                                c.sendMessage("Currect usage: ::tempmute-playername");
                                return;
                            }
                            String playerToMute = args[1];
                            int muteTimer = 48*3600000;

    for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
        if(Server.playerHandler.players != null) {
            if(Server.playerHandler.players.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMute)) {
                Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players;
                c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName+" for "+muteTimer/3600000+" Hours");
                                                    c2.muteEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ muteTimer;
                break;
            } 
        }
    }
                             
                                                                                 
} catch(Exception e) {
    c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
}

}[/code]

I’m assuming it works as is.

item.title: Temp Mute - Please look
item.dc:creator: @pk_evolution pk evolution
item.description:
@pk_evolution wrote:

Right i want that changing so that you can only mute for 48 hours using that command and not pick a time anyone know how to?

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“tempmute”) && c.playerRights >= 1 && c.playerRights <= 3) {

try {   
    String[] args = playerCommand.split("-");
                            if(args.length < 2) {
                                c.sendMessage("Currect usage: ::tempmute-playername-ammountofhours");
                                return;
                            }
                            String playerToMute = args[1];
                            int muteTimer = Integer.parseInt(args[2])*3600000;

    for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
        if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) {
            if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToMute)) {
                Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[i];
                c2.sendMessage("You have been muted by: " + c.playerName+" for "+muteTimer/3600000+" Hours");
                                                    c2.muteEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+ muteTimer;
                break;
            } 
        }
    }
                             
                                                                                 
} catch(Exception e) {
    c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
}

}

Read full topic
